Username Enter the desired name (This will be used to login from the Datamotive UI) Password Password for the user Full Name Name to be given to the user Email Email address Description Description to the user Role Select the desired role from the dropdown

Once all the information is entered click on configure and the user will be created as below -

User can be edited, removed using the respective options. To change the password, select the user and click on Reset Password –

Enter the password of the logged-in user mentioned in the dialogue box-

**Note – Only users that have SuperAdmin rights can change the password.

A temporary password will be generated for the selected user –

User can login using this password, and it will force the user to change the password for the first time.

docs.title: Identity Provider (SAML Authentication)
docs.text:
This option allows users to authenticate and sign-in using the users in domain.

To configure Identity Provider, click on the Service Provider Metadata URL. It will download the Datamotive Service Provider metadata file - “metadata". Rename the file as required and change the file extension to .xml.

Azure Active Directory Configuration  

  1. Sign in to your Azure management portal. Search for Microsoft Entra ID, click Microsoft Entra ID. Click the title of the directory you want to configure SSO for. Click Enterprise Application. Click New application and then click on “Create your own application”. Type a name, select non-gallery and click Create. 

  2. Go to the newly created custom app page and click on Single sign-on 

  3. On the Select a Single sign-on method dialog, select SAML mode to enable single sign-on.  

  4. Upload the Datamotive metadata .xml file and save the configuration. 

  1. Copy App Federation Metadata URL from the SAML Certificates section

  1. Click on edit of Attributes and Claims, it will show default claims. Copy the email address and name claim.

  1. Add New Claim of Name – Role, Namespace as same as other attributes like - http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims and Source Attribute – select user.assignedroles from the list. Copy the Role claim name also.

  1. Add User to the application and assign the Roles to the User. The default role “User” doesn’t have any value which is passed by Azure to Datamotive service provider. Roles can be created through Microsoft Graph Explorer (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/enterprise-app-role-management). The value of these roles is sent as the claim value in the SAML response which needs to provide in Datamotive Role mapping (which is Administrator). 

  2. On Datamotive UI, Identity Provider -> Click on “Configure SAML 2.0 Identity Provider”. It will open the configuration page.

  3. The configuration inputs are -  

Name Name of the configuration  Metadata URL  Provide the Identity Provider Metadata URL (Optional if File is Provided)  Metadata File  Provide the Identity Provider Metadata File (Optional if URL is Provided)  Email Address  Identity Provider User Email address attribute (This is used to fetch the SAML User email address from logged in Session)   Name   Identity Provider User Name attribute (This is used to fetch the SAML User Name from logged in Session)  Role  Identity Provider User Role attribute (This is used to fetch the SAML User Assigned Role from logged in Session)  Role Mapping  Map the Identity Provider Role with Datamotive Roles. Provide the Identity provider role name in Identity Provider Role and select the Datamotive Roles. Click + to save and add new one. 

  1. Click on configure to save the Identity Provider configuration. 

  2. Once configured, it will show the configuration.

docs.title: Once the configuration is complete, the configuration is shown as below
docs.text: To Edit the Configuration for Identity Provider click on Edit option and to Remove the configuration click on Remove option.

docs.title: Tech Support
docs.text:
Tech Support section is used to generate support bundles which helps to debug any issue occurred in the system.

To collect new support bundle, follow below steps.

  • Click on the +Generate button, new popup will be shown to trigger bundle creation.

  • Provide a proper description specifying why new support bundle generation is requested and click Generate Bundle

**Note: This operation may take several minutes complete, you can check the status of bundle in the list. (Click Refresh to update the status)

  • Post system accepts the generate bundle request it will collect all the required info from the node.

  • Note: This operation may take several minutes complete, you can check the status of bundle in the list. (Click Refresh to update the status)

  • Once support bundle generation completed, in the action section you will get a download icon.

    1. Use Download icon to download the support bundle

  1. Use delete icon to remove the support bundle from the system

docs.title: Upgrade
docs.text:
• The upgrade feature is used to upgrade the Datamotive services, features. To upgrade Datamotive solution, execute below mentioned steps on the Management server only for server as well as configured replication nodes. Upgrade needs to be done individually on management nodes of all sites.

**Note- Upgrade needs to be performed on both Source and Target Datamotive management nodes. Nodes with different versions on different sites may result in inconsistent behavior and may impact replication and recovery operations.

docs.title: Management Node
docs.text:
• Steps to upgrade the Datamotive Server and configured replication nodes:

  • Copy the “UPGRADE_PKG <version>. tar.gz” bundle/package to the Management server via Win-scp tool /scp command or any other tool at “/home/dmadmin” on the management node

  • Once the package is uploaded to the node, go to ‘dmadmin’ user directory using the below command

cd /home/dmadmin

  • Untar/Extract the bundle using the below command

untar –xf < UPGRADE_PKG {version}. tar.gz>

  • The user will use the dm-upgrade to upgrade the Management and associated Replication Nodes.

  • Enter following command to upgrade.

./dm-upgrade <DM_UPGRADE-***.tar.gz> Management

  • Once the cli prompts, enter the password for given username.

**Note – the password is the UI console login password

  • After the successful upgrade of the server and the node, success message would be displayed as per the below snip-

docs.title: Replication Nodes Only
docs.text:
In case the replication node is added/yet to be added to the Management node after the upgrade then follow the following steps –

  • Connect the replication node via ssh

  • Copy the latest “UPGRADE_PKG_ <version>. tar.gz” package to the replication node which needs to be upgraded via Win-scp tool /scp command or any other tool

**Note- For vmware, the default username/password for replication node is dmadmin/M0v3@nywh3r3. For clouds, user can SSH using the authentication provided by the cloud natively (key based or password based)

  • Once the package is uploaded to the replication node, go to ‘dmadmin’ user directory using the below command –

cd /home/dmadmin

  • untar the bundle using the below command

untar –xf < UPGRADE_PKG <version>. tar.gz>

  • The user will use the dm-upgrade to upgrade the replication node

Enter following command to upgrade.

./dm-upgrade <DM_UPGRADE-*** bundle.tar.gz> Replication

  • Once the upgrade is successful, the successful upgrade message will be shown.
